thread.title: PCM netters lose three at Fairfield tournament
thread.title_full: PCM netters lose three at Fairfield tournament

title: PCM netters lose three at Fairfield tournament
text:
PCM netters lose three at Fairfield tournament Published: Wednesday, Oct. 21, 2015 11:08 a.m. CDT • Updated: Wednesday, Oct. 21, 2015 12:07 p.m. CDT By Troy Hyde Newton Daily News 
FAIRFIELD — The Mustangs concluded the regular season with a trip to Fairfield on Saturday and returned home with losses to Davis County, 4A No. 15 Fairfield and Centerville. 
Fairfield went 3-0 in its home tourney and improved to 30-3 on the year. Centerville finished 2-1 in Fairfield, while Davis County’s lone win came against PCM. 
Davis County (21-20) defeated PCM in two sets, winning 25-13, 25-16. 
Senior Ashley Van Gorp had six of the Mustangs’ 11 kills in the contest and also had four digs. Junior Bailey Broderson finished with three kills and three aces, while junior Kayla Jennings had 10 assists and freshman Avery Stock added four digs. Junior Kaylee Townsend had five blocks. 
Fairfield, who leads the Southeast Conference with an undefeated record, downed PCM 25-16, 25-21. 
In that loss, Van Gorp had four kills and Broderson chipped in two. Jennings dished out eight assists and had five digs, while Van Gorp and Lippman each collected three digs. PCM was 32-of-35 in serves, and Broderson was 6-of-7 with three aces. 
Centerville (26-6) was the runner-up in the South Central Conference. The Redettes rallied passed the Mustangs for a three-set victory, winning 19-25, 25-20, 15-7. 
Broderson had a team-high four kills, while Van Gorp finished with three kills, 10 digs and two aces. Jennings had 12 assists and was 15-of-15 in serves. 
Stock and senior Kendal Earley collected eight digs while junior Tatum Nearmyer chipped in seven digs. Sophomore Regan Olson finished with three blocks and freshman Maddie Samson served up three aces. 
PCM (8-26) begins postseason play with a road trip to Saydel at 7 p.m. on Oct. 26. The winner faces either Clarke (1-19) or Chariton (9-17) at 7 p.m. on Oct. 29 in Chariton.
